prompt:
Read through this app’s codebase and swift files recursively to fully understand the codebase and all its different parts, and how it works, and how the various pieces fit together, and enhance it by improving the UI, adding new features, making it more performant and optimized and robust, and fixing all the bugs and errors. Use the Ralph Wiggum skill, and the swiftui skills and plugins. Be mindful that you are working on this codebase concurrently with codex, another coding agent. You can communicate with codex through leaving comments in the codebase and through beads issues. Use bead issues to create new issues and track their progress, and close them when they are resolved.
Update the app's UI to reflect Liquid Glass aesthetics as of macOS 26 Tahoe.
Add a dock icon for the app.
Why isn’t the clipboard text displayed in the app?
Add more customization features to the app’s settings
Improve the app’s ui to reflect the latest updates to swiftui and Apple’s human interface guidelines and design principles as of macOS 26.
Fix the issue where the copied text is not displayed in the clip queue view. 
Maybe add a feature that shows the app icon of the app where the copied text came from.
Improve performance and optimization of the app. It should be able to handle millions of copied text items without slowing down or crashing.
Add in a history feature.
Add in a categories feature that lets users create new categories and add copied text items to them.
Add in a pin feature that lets users pin important copied text for persistence.
use the apple docs mcp and cupertino mcp and xcode build mcp
 Search Bar: Real-time filtering with live results
App Icons: Shows source for each item
Color-Coded Categories: Visual organization
Context Menus: Right-click actions everywhere
Smooth Animations: 60fps with customizable speed
Responsive Design: Works on all screen sizes

> /plugin marketplace add thedotmack/claude-mem

> /plugin install claude-mem

run them   /plugin marketplace add thedotmack/claude-mem

  # Then install it
  /plugin install claude-mem

- Manual verification for clipboard capture (CQ-001): copy text with window hidden/inactive, confirm queue updates;
    record evidence and mark feature_fix_clipboard_display pass.
  - Manual verification for Dock icon (CQ-003): confirm Dock shows app asset; mark feature_dock_icon pass.
  - Liquid Glass polish (CQ-002): extend to Preferences window surfaces/toolbars and verify in light/dark; capture
    screenshots; mark feature_liquid_glass_ui pass.
  - Responsive layout (CQ-013): adapt header/search/segmented control and list spacing for narrow widths; validate small/
    large window sizes.
  - Performance at scale (CQ-009): queue persistence still uses UserDefaults; needs SwiftData/retention strategy, paging/
    indices, pruning, and stress test plan for millions of items.
  - Settings expansion (CQ-010): add retention limits, density/row height, and performance toggles tied to the scale work.
  - Smooth animations (CQ-012): animation speed currently only affects reorder; extend to insert/remove/pin transitions and
    verify 60fps.
  - Verification for remaining features: search (CQ-004), history persistence (CQ-006), categories (CQ-005), pinning (CQ-
    007), source app icons (CQ-008), context menus (CQ-011); update feature_list.json and close beads issues when
    confirmed.

  Prompt for Claude Code

  You’re picking up ClipQueue in /Users/rogerlin/Downloads/ClipQueue-main-2. Read handoff.md, agent-progress.txt,
  feature_list.json, and .beads/issues.jsonl first. Recent changes: added Liquid Glass-style helpers in Sources/Views/
  GlassStyle.swift; QueueView header/footer/search now use materials; empty states use ContentUnavailableView; shortcuts
  keycaps refreshed in PreferencesView; build+launch succeeded. App icon assets were added under Resources/Assets.xcassets.

  Tasks:
  1) Run XcodeBuildMCP build_macos (scheme ClipQueue) and launch the app.
  2) Manually verify: clipboard capture, Dock icon asset, history persistence, search filtering, categories + color badges,
  pinning, source app icons, context menus, animation speed. Update feature_list.json passes and close the matching beads
  issues.
  3) Continue remaining work: responsive layout (narrow widths), performance scale (SwiftData + retention/pruning + paging/
  indexing), and extend Liquid Glass polish in Preferences. Add any new settings needed (retention limits, density/perf
  toggles) and document in handoff.md and agent-progress.txt.
  Use beads issues for tracking and close when resolved. If a “Ralph Wiggum” skill exists in your environment, use it;
  otherwise proceed with macos-native-development guidance.. Also, see if you can implement a feature where the window hides or gets out of the way while still being accessible when a keyboard shortcut is pressed. what happened to the dock icon, and the settings window? the settings window is empty when opened. also in the history view, i want the selected items to be highlighted when selected.
never mind settings view is working. add more customization options, a context menu, a highlight background for selected items in the history view
run it

ok, i'm thinking that since this app doesnt have a minimize button, we need a way to get it out of the way when we're not using it, but allow it to keep recording and having a small icon there to remind us of its presence. maybe add a button or keyboard shortcut, which, when pressed, minimizes the window into the size of an icon with an animation. also, maybe add a bage to the dock icon of the app that counts how many items there are in the queue. also, what sound are you going with for the sound that is triggered when an item is copied? maybe add a different sound for when an item is pasted from queue. also, maybe add a custom color feature. also, the history is not working. it says History unavailable
History store failed to initialize. also, maybe let users select their own menubar icon from the SF symbols, and inckude a sf symbols picker, or let users upload a custom image to be used as a menubar icon. ultrathink

why is the settings menu hiding the other tabs? i want all the tabs in the settings menu to appear without being hidden. also, users should be able to pick the sf symbols visually, from a popup menu that displays all the sf symbools. also, when the settings menu appears, it should go to the forefront, even above the ClipQueue window. also allow users to select a custom accent color. add a settings customization option to change the translucency of the background of the ClipQueue window to be more transparent or less depending on the slider value. also, changing row density doesnt appear to change anything in the main view. /Users/rogerlin/Documents/ScreenCaptures/Xcode\ 2026-01-02\ at\ 04.17.14@2x.png /Users/rogerlin/Documents/ScreenCaptures/iStatistica\ Pro\ 2026-01-02\ at\ 04.17.04@2x.png also, here's the app's ui so far. see if you can make it even better and swiftui native and macos native. i dont like how the background color of the app's main view in light mode looks. the top and bottom white bars are too standing out-ish, and the background is barely translucent even though i have the opacity settings and blur settings quite low.

add color picker and add all the sf symbols as of sf symbols 7 dynamically. make the animation where the window shrinks into a tiny app icon inside a small view container  with a badge that shows the item count and that does a little animation whenever a new item is added. the app icon should be freely positionable around the screen and should be draggable. dragging something to the app icon should add it to the queue. also, add a cusomization option that lets users change the size of the app icon of the source app that the item is from in the main view. the character count isnt being shownn. also, add support for copying hex colors or rbg colors, where the app will automatically detect when a hex color or rgb color with or without the # sign is copied, and will change the background color of the copied item to the hex or rgb color.
yes, and keep the supermemory and mcp agent mail updated
push it to github. there should be an existing repo but if not,create one
add an option to add a newline after paste in the settings menu

ok i want an option added to the settings menu to remove item after pasting. actually, that should be the default
  option, and not removing after pasting should be the nondefault option. also add a paste and remove option to the right
  click context menu that pastes the item in the previous app's textfield that is selected. also add a paste next and
  paste previous option, that pastes the item after and before the selected item in the previous app's selected textfield
  respectively. also, do you think you could add support for images, and display a thumbnail of the copied image in the
  queue, and open it up in quickview when it is selected and the space bar is pressed, and add an option to copy the
  image's filepath in the right click context menu when an image in the queue is right clicked? if its not feasible, thats
  ok too. also, do you think you could style the link better, so that it is blue and underlined, and the app automatically
  detects links when they are copied and added to the queue? and clicking on the link will open it up in the default
  crowser, but only when the link itself is clicked, and not the surrounding area?  also, add a button to the UI to
  reverse the order of the queue. use the apple docs mcp and cupertino mcp and xcode build mcp
continue

familiarize yourself with the codebase by reading through the swift files recursively in this codebase. use beads to
    create new issues and to keep track of progress and update your progress. use the apple docs mcp, cupertino mcp, and
    example apple sample code in /Users/rogerlin/SwiftDB for inspiration and guidance on how Apple software engineers
    approach the design and building of macos apps. Here are your tasks. work through them methodically, taking the time
  to
    understand the issue, where it is in the codebase, diagnose the problem, figure out a solution, plan, and then execute
    systematically and with close attention to detail. Option in settings menu to add new line after paste with enter, or
    shift + enter

    Option to automatically resize the height of the clip queue view depending on the number of items in the queue, so
  that
    if there are fewer items in the queue, the height of the clip queue view should be smaller, but the size of each item
    remains the same.

    Custom menubar icon not displaying correctly. It still shows the default menubar icon

    Option to select multiple items from the clipboard queue with either command click or or shift click. Once the items
  are
    selected, pressing delete with remove the selected items, pressing enter will paste the items in the order they were
    selected, with a line break after each item. Likewise, pressingg control w on a bunch of selected items will paste
  them
    sequentially in the order they were selected, in the previous app’s selected textfield. Pressing enter or control w on
  a
    single selected item will paste it in the previous app’s selected textfield. Pressing space on a single selected item
  it
    cause a quick view preview of the item, or a popup view to appear. Add a context menu option for Add to Favorites, and
    add the Favorites tab to the segmented picker at the top which currently has Queue, History. Add a gold star to the
  item
    that is favorited. Also, add a Recents to a segmented picker added to the bottom, and also move the History tab to the
    segmented picker, so that there should be a segmented picker on the top left of the app, with Queue and Favorites, and
    another segmented picker to the bottom center, with History and Recents. Of course, add the options to toggle/hide the
    History, Favorites, and Recents tabs, in which case if there are only 3, including Queue, just show a three tab
    segmented picker on the top. Only if there are 4, including Queue, should you show two segmented pickers, one on the
    top, and one on the bottom. Add a keyboard shortcut for navigating between the different tabs of the segmented
  pickers,
    and an option in the settings to return to the Queue tab after hiding and showing the clip queue, or to memorize the
    previous tab that was open and persist it even after hiding and revealing the clip queue. Remove the “View“ text from
    the left of the segmented picker. Also, dragging and dropping items from the segmented picker to another app’s
  textfield
    should paste the contents of that item into the textfield it is dropped on. Also, the app doesnt let you change the
    keyboard shortcuts. Make it so that any combination of keys is allowed for a keyboard shortcut, such as left shift +
    left tab. It shouldnt require a modifier key to be a keyboard shortcut. ultrathink. use the swiftui agents and skills
    and any other resources at your disposal.

review the codebase's swift files recursively to understand the codebase. we are in the final stretches of developing this app, which is already in a working state, so don't screw things up. don't let your guard down now, and be on watch for any bugs, hidden errors, or bottlenecks. begin by reading through the codebase, both to understand the code, what this app does, how all the pieces fit together, and to find and identify and note and address any bugs, issues, inefficiencies, bottlenecks, etc. create a new branch and push to git. then implement the following changes and refinements, as well as any others you can think of to improve this app. 
Add a context window for the menubar. The context window should be a dropdown menu that appears when the user clicks on the menubar icon. The dropdown menu should contain the following options: “Show Window”, “Hide Window”, “Minimize Window”, “Maximize Window”, “Close Window”, “About”, “Preferences”, “Quit”. 

Make sure every customization option in the settings menu is working properly, and not just there for show but doesn’t actually do anything.

Make app appear and hide on clicking on the dock icon, as well as on clicking on the menubar icon. This should be implemented in a way that is both efficient and user-friendly, ensuring that the window appears and hides smoothly and without any lag or delay. 

Allow users to map shortcuts to any keys they want, without requiring modifier keys

Auto adjusting the window height based on the number of items isn’t working properly. I want it to adjust the window height so that if there is only 1 item that is copied on the queue, the window height should be just enough to show that one item, without clipping it with the top and bottom bars, or making the window too tall. If an item is added to the queue, the window height should automatically adjust to show the newly added item as well. When an item is removed from the queue, the window height should automatically adjust to show the remaining items in the queue. This auto-adjusting feature should work smoothly and without any lag or delay. I want to make sure that the window height is always appropriate for the number of items in the queue, and that the window does not become too tall or too short as items are added or removed from the queue. The auto-adjusting window height feature should be implemented in a way that is both efficient and user-friendly, ensuring that the window height adapts seamlessly to the changing number of items in the queue. . be meticulous and don't make any mistakes. this is the last leg. don't let the app fuck up now. ultrathink.

ok, when i copy something to the queue, it doesnt update the ui automatically, i have to switch tabs to favorites or something and then switch back to the queue before the second item becomes visible. also, the app window is still clipping the bottom item. the height ultrathink. also its not letting me bind a shortcut to fn + tab. the recents tab should only include items frm the queue that were pasted, not all that were copied and added to the queue. when i press spacebar on the queue, i want a popup window to appear that shows me the full contents of the copied text, as well as stats about it, the icon of the app it was from, just like a quickview popup, and when i press the spacebar again, the popup view should disappear. current, when i press space bar on a selected item in the queue, it just adds a space to the searchbar search
